channel.title: Login Messages
channel.description:
Hey. Im using a 317 Delta server and whilst ive been looking through some of the development sections, i have seen servers with login messages with admin crowns next to it. I was wondering if you can do this on a 317 or if its just 508+? I'd be grateful if anyone could help please :)
Thanks, Rares

item.title: Login Messages
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

The crown next to the message inside the chatbox is client-sided. It is also client-sided if you wanted to change that text to red.

Yes, you can use the sendFrame or sendQuest with @colorhere@, but that is only for interfaces.

Read full topic

item.title: Login Messages
item.dc:creator: @Avalon Avalon
item.description:
@Avalon wrote:

[quote=“RarerThanRares, post:4, topic:275758”]Mod Elite. I tried your code…

client.java:9427: sendFrame126(java.lang.String,int) in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.String) sendFrame126("@dre@Hello!"); ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Got that error…[/quote]

I don’t think he exactly knows what he is doing.

Look at the parameters of the method- you need an integer to indicate the location of the text.

sendFrame126("Hello!", 1000); //1000 is just an example

That won’t display an admin crown next to login messages though.

Read full topic

item.title: Login Messages
item.dc:creator: @RarerThanRares RarerThanRares
item.description:
@RarerThanRares wrote:

Mod Elite. I tried your code…

client.java:9427: sendFrame126(java.lang.String,int) in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.String) sendFrame126("@dre@Hello!"); ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Got that error…

Read full topic

item.title: Login Messages
item.dc:creator: @vic_08 Vic_
item.description:
@vic_08 wrote:

I’m sure it can be done. Just follow the way that the 508’s do it. Mess around with it.

[quote=“Mod Elite, post:2, topic:275758”]Heres the code, place it next to ur login message in ur client.java:

sendFrame126("@dre@

Go to java.com, then read everything there before posting. Thank you

Read full topic

item.description:

Heres the code, place it next to ur login message in ur client.java:
